subject: Football
lead_paragraph: When Michael Lewis’s book “The Blind Side: Evolution of a Game” came out in 2006, it brought a lot of attention to the position of left tackle and gave fans a glimpse of how important offensive line play is to success in the N.F.L. This season, it seems a few quarterbacks are determined to prove that they can be successful even if they spend most of the game picking mud out of their face masks.
